opinion.court: Supreme Court of the United States
opinion.case_name: Reginald Lush v. Commissioner of Education of New York

opinion:
366 U.S. 167

81 S.Ct. 1044

6 L.Ed.2d 201

Reginald LUSH
v.
COMMISSIONER OF EDUCATION OF NEW YORK.

No. 683.

Supreme Court of the United States

April 24, 1961

Francis G. Hessney, for appellant.

Charles A. Brind, for appellee.

Max G. Morris, for intervenor-appellee Board of Education Central School Dist. No. 1.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motions to dismiss are granted and the appeal is dismissed. Treating the papers whereon the appeal was taken as a petition for writ of certiorari, certiorari is denied.
